p:
The CH 2, CH 3, and n‐3 CH 3 signals were quantified in jMRUI with the AMARES algorithm. 23 In oils, only the CH 2 peak and central peaks of the methyl triplets were fitted with a single Gaussian line (oil prior knowledge). The T 2 relaxation times were calculated in MATLAB (MathWorks, Natick, MA, USA), with the following monoexponential fitting function:
(3)
S
TE
=
S 0
exp
− TE /
T 2
where S 0 represents the signal (magnetization) at TE = 0 msec. The coefficient of determination (R 2) was used as an indicator of the quality of the fit.
